transliteration: Juddhan Jujjhaaran Boubbaade|| Rulleee Pakdareee Aahaade||120||
translation: The warriors were mumbling and falling as martyrs and the heroes wearing armours were rolling in dust.120.

gurmukhi: ਬੱਕੇ ਬੱਬਾੜੇ ਬੰਕਾਰੰ || ਨੱਚੇ ਪੱਖਰੀੲੇ ਜੁਝਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bakke Babbaade Bankaaran|| Nachche Pakkdareee Jujhaaran||
translation: The brave fighters thundered and the warriors wearing steel armours, being intoxicated, began to dance.

gurmukhi: ਬੱਜੇ ਸੰਗਲੀੲੇ ਭੀਹਾਲੇ || ਰਣ ਰੱਤੇ ਮੱਤੇ ਮੁੱਛਾਲੇ ||੧੨੧||
transliteration: Bajje Sanadeee Bhedhaale|| Ran Ratte Matte Mouchcdhaale||121||
translation: The terrible trumpets resounded and the warriors with dreadful whiskers began to fight in the war.121.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਛਲੀੲੇ ਕੱਛੀ ਕੱਛਾਲੇ || ੳੁੱਡੇ ਜਣੁ ਪੱਬੰ ਪੱਛਾਲੇ ||
transliteration: Ouchhaleee Kachchhikachcdhaale|| Udde Jan(u) Pabban Pachcdhaale||
translation: The warriors were fighting with each other while twisting their whiskers. The chopping heroes were jumping like the winged mountains.

gurmukhi: ਜੁੱਟੇ ਭਟ ਛੁੱਟੇ ਮੁੱਛਾਲੇ || ਰੁਲੀੲੇ ਅਾਹਾੜੰ ਪਖਰਾਲੇ ||੧੨੨||
transliteration: Joutte Bhat Chhoutte Mouchcdhaale|| Ruleee Aahaadan Pakhraale||122||
translation: The brave soldiers wearing armours are lying down on the earh.122.

gurmukhi: ਬੱਜੇ ਸੰਧੂਰੰ ਨੱਗਾਰੇ || ਕੱਛੇ ਕੱਛੀਲੇ ਲੁੱਝਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Bajje Sandhooran Naggdare|| Kachchhe Kachchheele Lujjhdare||
translation: The trumpets resounded upto distant places and the horses began to run hither and thither.

gurmukhi: ਗਣ ਹੂਰੰ ਪੂਰੰ ਗੈਣਾਯੰ || ਅੰਜਨਯੰ ਅੰਜੇ ਨੈਣਾਯੰ ||੧੨੩||
transliteration: Gad Hooran Pooran Gadnaayan|| Anjanayan Anje Nainaayan||123||
translation: The heavenly damsels began to roam in the sky and bedecking themselves and putting collyrium in their eyes they began to see the war.123.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਣੱਕੇ ਨਾਦੰ ਨਾਫੀਰੰ || ਬੱਬਾੜੇ ਬੀਰੰ ਹਾਬੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Ran Nakke Naadan Naaphderan|| Babbaade Bderan Haabderan||
translation: The thundering musical instruments were played in the war and the brave soldiers roared.

gurmukhi: ੳੁੱਘੇ ਜਣ ਨੇਜੇ ਜੱਟਾਲੇ || ਛੁੱਟੇ ਸਿਲ ਸਿਤਿਯੰ ਮੁੱਛਾਲੇ ||੧੨੪||
transliteration: Ougghe Jan Neje Jattaale|| Chhoutte Seel Sitiyan Mouchcdhaale||124||
translation: The warriors holding their spears in their hands began to strike them, the arms and weapons of the warriors were put to use.124.

gurmukhi: ਭਟ ਡਿੱਗੇ ਘਾਯੰ ਅੱਘਾਯੰ || ਤਨ ਸੁੱਭੇ ਅੱਧੇ ਅੱਧਾਯੰ ||
transliteration: Bhat Digge Ghaayan Agghaayan|| Tan Soubbhe Addho Addhaayan||
translation: The wounded warriors fell down and their bodies were chopped.

gurmukhi: ਦਲ ਗੱਜੇ ਬੱਜੇ ਨੀਸਾਣੰ || ਚੰਚਲੀੲੇ ਤਾਜੀ ਚੀਹਾਣੰ ||੧੨੫||
transliteration: Dal Gadje Bajje Nisaanan|| Channdhaleee Taajicheehaanan||125||
translation: The armies thundered and the trumpets resounded, the restless horses neighed in the battlefield.125.

gurmukhi: ਚਵ ਦਿਸਯੰ ਚਿੰਕੀ ਚਾਵੰਡੈ || ਖੰਡੇ ਖੰਡੇ ਕੈ ਅਾਖੰਡੈ ||
transliteration: Chav Disyan Chinkichaavandai|| Khande Khande Kai Aakhanndai||
translation: The vultures shrieked on all the four sides and they began to reduce already chopped bodies into bits.

transliteration: Ran Danke Giddhan Uddhaanan|| Jai Janpaisindhan Suddhaanan||126||
translation: In the jungle of that battlefield they began to play with the bits of flesh and the adepts and yogis wished for victory.126.

gurmukhi: ਫੁੱਲੇ ਜਣ ਕਿੱਸਕ ਬਾਸੰਤੰ || ਰਣ ਰੱਤੇ ਸੂਰਾ ਸਾਮੰਤੰ ||
transliteration: Phulle Jan Kissak Baasantan|| Ran Ratte Sooraa Saamanndan||
translation: Just as the flowers blossom in the spring, in the same manner are seen the mighty warriors fighting in the war.
